file_content.text: I surrender. Please, don't hurt me.
Why didn't they listen to me?
Now the Flesh Raiders will destroy us for sure.
This was all a terrible mistake.
I know it doesn't matter to you, but I did all this to save my people.
It wasn't supposed to be like this. I was going to save you--save us all.
The harder you hold onto me, the more you lose control.
Emotions cloud your judgment.
I've lost so much, and I couldn't lose you, too.
You gave my Master to the enemy!
You betrayed Master Orgus.
No, you can still save him.
Bengel Morr wants to destroy my order, and you handed him my Master.
What about the Jedi?
There's still time to save them.
Idiot.
My people were dying. What choice did I have?
Everything just happened so fast.
Bengel Morr took Orgus to someplace called the Forge. Reactivate your droid--it might know where to find them.
Isn't that information worth some mercy?
I don't believe in forgiving scum like you.
Mercy isn't in my vocabulary.
You can forgive me, can't you?
I would've died before I let anyone hurt my sister. I swear it.
It was never in my heart to betray you. Forgive me, please.
I don't condone what you've done, but I understand.
I forgive you, Ranna.
I... that's not what I expected.
Thank you. I am so sorry.
You're more forgiving than any sister I could've hoped for.
I'm so sorry for all this.
Tell me what I can do to make this right.
Learn from this mistake. Spend your life atoning for what you've done.
Dedicate yourself to goodness.
I won't waste this chance. That's a promise.
You're not fit to lead your people. You have to step down.
Give up your position.
You're right. I'm not the Matriarch my mother was.
I should tell my people what's happened. We'll bury and mourn our dead.
My people should hear what's happened. It's best if I tell them.
I forgive you--but I don't want to know you.
Just go away.
Why? Why would you forgive me and then destroy me?
I can see in your eyes--you still hate me.
I understand. Forgiving isn't the same as forgetting.
I hope you find your Master....
You've done terrible things. There must be consequences.
Your crimes are great.
You're right. Tell me what I should do.
Surrender to the Jedi Council. Confess your crimes.
Turn yourself in.
The settlement will be better off without me.
All I've done is get people killed. That's a debt I have to repay.
The others will come, too. We should all confess our crimes.
I'll go to the temple immediately. I hope you find your Master....
Take the next shuttle off this planet. Never come back.
I want you gone from Tython.
My people are dead because of me. I deserve to be banished.
Maybe that's for the best. I'm not the Matriarch my mother was.
You'll always be my sister.
I'm sorry for all this. You deserved better.
I hope you find your Master. Goodbye.
I'll make sure your crimes stay between us--if you show the proper appreciation.
Pay me to forget this.
After all this, you demand tribute? You've seen how poor we are.
You've seen our settlement. We have no wealth.
My people brought a few sacred relics to Tython. They're valuable. I'll tell my people the Flesh Raiders stole them.
I can't stand to be in here anymore....
There's no excuse for what you've done. You deserve to be punished.
Being sorry won't save you.
There's nothing I can do to stop you, is there?
Hasn't there been enough suffering already?
Please--hasn't there been enough ugliness between us?
Can't you find it in your heart to forgive me?
If I ever see you again, you're dead.
Run for your life.
Thank you for sparing me....
How can you be so cruel?
Your eyes have nothing but hatred in them....
You would kill me, after we... what kind of man are you?
You earned this. [Hit Ranna.]
Get out of my sight.
You don't deserve to live.
No. [Kill Ranna]
Master Orgus responded to your distress call. I was to meet him here. What's happened?
Nothing. We didn't send any distress call. Things have been quiet since you left.
I haven't seen or spoken to Master Orgus.
T7 = scanning area // Stand by....
Confirmed // Master Orgus = not in settlement + not answering holocom
Master Orgus should've gotten here ahead of me.
That's very suspicious.
T7 = contact Jedi Temple?
Someone sent Master Orgus a distress call from here. Who was it?
Any ideas, Ranna?
You disappeared for a long time. Where have you been?
I don't trust you, droid.
T7 = conducted high-level scan of wilderness + detected many Flesh Raider patrols
Jedi + T7 = go find Master Orgus?
I wish you hadn't come. Would have made things easier....
We didn't want to hurt you or your Master, but we have no choice.
Where is Master Orgus? What did you do to him?
What have you done?
I don't believe this. We protected you people!
You traitors.
Only when it was convenient. For months, we begged the Council to send help!
And no matter how many you kill, the Flesh Raider numbers keep growing. You can't win.
I'm sure it's a misunderstanding. Your Master will turn up.
Why don't you stay a while? You must be exhausted.
Don't worry. As long as we're together, everything will be alright.
Stay here a while. I feel safer when you're close.
Stop it! What are you doing?
Matriarch, step aside. Handing over the girl's Master wasn't enough. This Padawan has to die.
I told you to leave my sister alone! That was the pact!
Matriarch, step aside. Handing over the boy's Master wasn't enough. This Padawan has to die.
I told you to leave him alone! That was the pact!
Bengel Morr refused your terms. This is to save our people!
What did you do to my Master? Where's Bengel Morr?
What have you done?
You lied to my face. How could you do that?
I trusted you, Ranna.
I had no choice. There are too many Flesh Raiders, and not enough Jedi.
I was trying to save you. The Jedi are doomed--but you'd be safe if you stayed here.
Your Jedi can't win. They're all going to die--but I can save you.
What did you inject me with?
You poisoned me!
Something to stop you from escaping--and numb the pain. I don't want you to suffer.
The toxin will make this easier on everyone.
Bengel Morr came to me. Said he'd end the Flesh Raider attacks if we gave him your Master.
He wants us to kill you, too. I... I'm sorry.
You made a deal with a monster. You won't like the consequences.
So am I.
I'm not. [Attack]
He asked us to kill you, too--but I said "no." I told him we'd keep you here.
You'd be safe, and my people would have a protector.
You can't do this, Moorint. She's my family.
Please, Moorint. You can't hurt him.
If we don't do what we're told, Bengel Morr will kill us all.
Bengel Morr is a monster. When he's done using you, he'll kill everyone.
He'll kill you anyway.
Don't resist. It'll only make things harder.
You don't want to hurt anyone. You want to leave here peacefully.
[Force Persuade] Go in peace.
I... I don't want to hurt anyone.
We should leave here peacefully.
Yes. Better that way. Here, perhaps you can use these. We don't need them....
You people make me sick.
I've heard enough. [Attack]
I've destroyed the machines poisoning your crops.
You have this entire settlement's gratitude. I'm told you suffered greatly on our behalf.
My scouts recovered these items from the ruins. They're yours now, as we agreed. I hope you profit from them.
Now, please excuse me--my people need guidance and reassurance....
I saw how you suffered out there. What you did was more than brave--it was heroic.
Since you came here, all you've done is risk your life to save us.
Please take a token of my people's honor. I'm sorry it can't be more.
Rewards aren't necessary, but thank you.
It's very generous.
Jedi don't need rewards.
You've done more than any outsider ever has.
My mother was strong, like you. It's hard, being alone with all this.
Everyone in this settlement is your family, now. Be strong for them.
Look to your people.
You're right. A leader must learn how to stand alone.
You're stronger than you know. You can do anything you set your mind to.
You can handle it.
You make me feel like I can take on the whole galaxy.
You can always count on me, Ranna. I won't let you down.
I'm here for you.
You're a better friend than any I've ever had. I hope somehow my mother knows you're watching over me.
I've heard it said friends are the family we choose for ourselves. My mother was all the family I had left, until you came.
That's strange, isn't it? I've only known you a little while, but it's like you're the sister I've always wanted.
Ranna, it's natural for you to seek comfort from others, but I'm not your sister.
You're confused by grief.
You're right. Forgive me if I've made you uncomfortable.
You hardly know anything about me.
What makes you say that?
I know you're brave and honest--and that you care about others more than yourself.
I know I can trust you. That's all that matters.
Glad I'm not the only one who feels that connection.
I know what you mean.
It's an incredible gift to have someone who's always there for you, no matter what.
My people have an old ritual for friends to become family. Would you perform it with me? Become my sister?
We don't have to be sisters to look out for each other.
Friendship is good enough.
You always know the right thing to say and do. Friends, then.
Jedi aren't allowed to place one person above others, Ranna. We have to treat everyone like they're family.
My code forbids it.
I think I understand. It's too bad, though. You'd make a wonderful big sister.
Having a sister like you would be wonderful.
Yes, I'd like that.
Then come, sit--let's take the oaths of family together....
There, we're sisters now. Our bond is forever. Always together, never alone.
I'll always be there for you, Ranna--no matter what.
Sisters to the end.
These kinds of attachments are against the Jedi Code. I shouldn't have done this.
This was a mistake.
Don't say that. The bonds of family make us stronger than any code. You'll see--sister.
Let's keep this between us. I don't think my Master would approve.
We shouldn't tell Orgus.
I don't need anyone else to know--just you.
Here, take this. Whenever we're apart, I'll still be with you.
Why would you face death again and again for people you barely know?
My order's greatest honor is to protect and serve others.
That's what Jedi do.
You serve your ideals well.
I can't stand by and do nothing while others suffer.
Because I care about people.
So many of my people mistrust the Jedi. I wish they could know you like I do.
You're worth the risk.
[Flirt] I do it for you.
Me? You don't even know me.
You're strong, capable--a good person. What else should I know?
[Flirt] I know enough.
I've lost so much. All I seem to have left are responsibilities.
We'll finish this some other time. I have a job to do.
Nevermind. I should go.
Yes, of course. I'm sorry if I kept you from it.
Haven't you noticed I keep coming back to you? It's not just my duty.
[Flirt] But I want to.
Duties are all I seem to have, now.
Being a Matriarch means putting your own needs second. It's the same for Jedi, isn't it?
There's more to life than responsibility for others. There has to be.
[Flirt] I hope not.
For all her victories, my mother spent her life alone. I don't want that.
If there's anything I can do as a friend, let me know.
Yes, but we can be friends.
I will. Thank you.
Rules are for servants and slaves.
[Flirt] We deserve more.
But I thought Jedi weren't allowed to... I mean... should you be doing this?
If we both feel the same way, what does it matter?
[Flirt] Who cares?
I... I do feel the same way. And I don't care about your Jedi rules.
I have feelings for you--but as a Jedi, I'm not allowed to act on them.
No, I shouldn't.
What a lonely way to live. It's no wonder there aren't more Jedi in the galaxy.
Even though you don't believe in accepting rewards, I insist you take this one.
Please accept this token of affection from my people. You've earned it.
Right now, all I want is you.
[Flirt] I can't help myself.
And I want you, too.
I'll make sure no one disturbs us....
If we stay much longer, my people will wonder--and I don't want you to get in trouble with your Master.
There won't be any trouble. You bring out the best in me, Ranna.
You're beautiful.
You were right. We shouldn't have done this.
This was a mistake.
Don't say that. I can't regret something this good.
Orgus doesn't get to tell me who I can be with.
He doesn't scare me.
But he might expel you from the Jedi. I wouldn't want that.
Here, this is something for when we're apart.
My people are probably looking for me. I'll see you again soon, I hope.
No, I insist. You deserve this.
I'm sure I'll find a use for it, somehow.
So am I.
We're not wealthy, but my people give all they can.
I should go inform everyone that the danger is over.
The poison machines are in the fields. Please, do something.
I shut down the energy shield. Any word on Master Orgus's mission?
No. My mother... she found peace during your absence. I'm now Matriarch.
You have my sympathies, Ranna--but your people are in good hands.
You're going to be alright.
You're kind to say that. I've heard people call the Jedi cold, but it's not true.
You don't have to go through this alone.
I'm here if you need me.
You and your Master are a great comfort to me.
People who say Jedi have no feelings are wrong.
As long as you cooperate, I have no problem with your new position.
Doesn't matter.
How are you so cold? Are only Masters allowed to express warmth and comfort?
Before he left, Master Orgus told me "There is no death, there is the Force."
He believes our essence lives on when we die and merges with the Force. I hope that's true.
Matriarch! Flesh Raiders broke through our defenses. They did something to our crop fields!
They dropped strange machines in the soil. When a scout approached one, he collapsed with sickness.
He crawled away from the device and began to recover--but there are many more machines still out there.
Tell your people to stay away from the fields. I'll get rid of these things.
Let me deal with this.
Be careful. If the machines are too powerful, save yourself.
Once again, I'm in your debt.
I've never heard of anything like this before.
What are these devices?
If these machines can poison us, they can destroy our crops as well.
Your settlement here is finished. You can't stay on Tython.
It's time you left this world.
We have nowhere else to go. My people will kill themselves dismantling those machines.
Please, help us. Jedi are strong. You can resist the machines and destroy them.
I'll take out as many of them as I can.
I'll do my best, Matriarch.
There's always a chance.
If I've learned anything, it's that Jedi succeed where others fail.
If I have to root through your fields, I expect something in return.
For a price.
My scouts find things in Tython's ancient ruins. I can give you what they've salvaged.
Hurry to the fields. I fear we don't have much time.
My hopes go with you. Take care.
Your Master wants to talk to you.
Your mission sounds dangerous. Be careful.
One of our scouts watched from a distance while you invaded the Flesh Raider camp. He said you defeated many of them.
With the weapons and technology you brought from the Flesh Raiders, my people can defend themselves.
Your heroism gives me hope that we'll survive this.
And your Matriarch? Is she feeling any better?
How is your mother?
No, but we're doing all we can. Thank you for asking.
Moorint? Our friend should know everything we've learned about the Flesh Raiders.
You risked your life to help us. My people haven't had a champion for some time.
Jedi have a duty to protect and defend others.
It's my honor to serve.
And we promised to share our knowledge in return for that duty.
I'll be your champion whenever you need one.
[Flirt] Call on me anytime.
Oh. I... ah, should give you the information you requested. Moorint, report.
I did as you asked--for information, nothing more.
Don't get sentimental.
Of course. And I will honor that bargain.
Scouts report that the Flesh Raider forces are gathering in strength.
They already control the mountains around us, and now they're invading the ruins of Kaleth.
My men spotted them at the remains of an ancient shrine--close to your Jedi Temple.
Kaleth was a great city of Force users. Its ruins hold powers we still don't understand.
The Flesh Raiders are looking for something there.
We can't let them find it. Drive back those Flesh Raiders immediately. I have to take this droid back to the Council.
That hooded figure in the holo--I know his voice. The situation is worse than I thought.
Do whatever it takes to push the Flesh Raiders out of Kaleth. I'll send you reinforcements as soon as possible.
I'll hold the line until reinforcements arrive, Master.
I'll be ready for anything.
You aren't going to tell me what's happening?
Wait, that's it?
Take too long. Just be aware that Kaleth is a place of great danger.
In case you haven't noticed, I handle things just fine by myself.
I won't need them.
Don't get cocky. You're good, but you're still a Padawan.
If you see that hooded figure from the holo, do not engage him. Now get going.
Saylew is upset. Perhaps he'll listen to you.
If you bring us the Flesh Raider weapons, we'll put them to good use.
Our Matriarch will speak with you.
Please excuse me. Others require my full attention.
